snippet: A more tangible economic upswing could help Democrats keep the White House after the Obama administration’s long struggle with slow economic recovery.
abstract: Surprisingly strong October jobs report makes Federal Reserve interest rate increase look more likely, as well as bolstering Democrats hoping to keep White House in 2016; 271,000 new jobs were added, with average hourly earnings rising 0.4 percent; improvement could mute Republican calls for change; growth remains weak, however, and much of electorate remains upset over prospects.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and BINYAMIN APPELBAUM

lead_paragraph: A more tangible economic upswing could help Democrats keep the White House after the Obama administration’s long struggle with slow economic recovery.

headline.main: If Jobs Report Heralds a Solid Upturn, Democrats’ Fortunes May Also Rise
headline.print_headline: Jobs Report Signals Shift in Economy, and Politics
